ayas.translation: An asker asked for a punishment sure to befall
—which none can avert from the faithless —
from Allah, Lord of the lofty stations.

ayas.arabic: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
ayas.translation: The angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in a day whose span is fifty thousand years.
ayas.transliteration: ta`rujul malā-ikatu war rūḥu ilayhi fī yawmin kāna miqdāruhu khamsīna alfa sanah

ayas.translation: So be patient, with a patience that is graceful.
Indeed they see it to be far off,
and We see it to be near.
The day when the sky will be like molten copper,
and the mountains like [tufts of] dyed wool,
and no friend will inquire about [the welfare of his] friend,

ayas.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ
ayas.translation: [though] they will be placed within each other’s sight. The guilty one will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that day at the price of his children,
ayas.transliteration: yubaṣṣarūnahum ۚ yawaddul mujrimu law yaftadī min `adhābi yawmi-idhin bibanīh

ayas.translation: his spouse and his brother,
his kin, which had sheltered him

ayas.arabic: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
ayas.translation: and all those who are upon the earth, if that might deliver him.
ayas.transliteration: wa man fil-arḍi jamī`an thumma yunjīh

ayas.translation: Never! Indeed, it is a blazing fire,
which strips away the scalp.
It invites him, who has turned back [from the truth] and forsaken [it],
amassing [wealth] and hoarding [it].
Indeed man has been created covetous:
anxious when an ill befalls him
and grudging [charity] when good comes his way
—[all are such] except the prayerful,
those who persevere in their prayers
and there is a known share in whose wealth
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna fī amwālihim ḥaqqun ma`lūm

ayas.translation: for the beggar and the deprived,
and who affirm the Day of Retribution,

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
ayas.translation: and those who are apprehensive of the punishment of their Lord
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum min `adhābi rabbihim mushfiqūn

ayas.translation: (there is indeed no security from the punishment of their Lord)
and those who guard their private parts

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
ayas.translation: (apart from their spouses and their slave women, for then they are not blameworthy;
ayas.transliteration: illā `alā azwājihim aw mā malakat aymānuhum fa-innahum ghayru malūmīn

ayas.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
ayas.translation: but whoever seeks beyond that—it is they who are the transgressors)
and those who keep their trusts and covenants,
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna hum li-amānātihim wa`ahdihim rā`ūn

ayas.translation: and those who are observant of their testimonies,
and those who are watchful of their prayers.
They will be in gardens, held in honour.
What is the matter with the faithless that they scramble toward you,
from left and right, in groups?

ayas.arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
ayas.translation: Does each man among them hope to enter the garden of bliss?
ayas.transliteration: ayaṭma`u kullum-ri-in minhum an yudkhala jannata na`īm

ayas.translation: Never! Indeed, We created them from what they know.

ayas.arabic: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَـٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
ayas.translation: So I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that We are able
ayas.transliteration: falā uqsimu birabbil mashāriqi wal maghāribi innā laqādirūn

ayas.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
ayas.translation: to replace them with [others] better than them and We are not to be outmaneuvered.
ayas.transliteration: `alā an nubaddila khayran minhum wa mā naḥnu bimasbūqīn

ayas.arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
ayas.translation: So leave them to gossip and play till they encounter the day they are promised:
ayas.transliteration: fadharhum yakhūḍū wayal`abū ḥattā yulāqū yawmahumul ladhī yū`adūn

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
ayas.translation: the day when they emerge from graves, hastening, as if racing toward a target,
ayas.transliteration: yawma yakhrujūna minal-ajdāthi sirā`an ka-annahum ilā nuṣubiy yūfiḍūn

ayas.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
ayas.translation: with a humbled look [in their eyes], overcast by abasement. That is the day they had been promised.
ayas.transliteration: khāshi`atan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillah ۚ dhālikal yawmul ladhī kānū yū`adūn
